replies.author: achilep

replies.bodyText:
did you even use the live template in here?
or do you mean the intellij junit 4 to 5 migration tool?
What can help a bit is to exclude a few packages from import suggestions by IntelliJ. So when you let IntelliJ import a method for you it will automatically choose the one from the jupiter package
You need to exclude these

groovy.util.GroovyTestCase.*
junit.framework.*
org.junit.Assert.*
see


and dont forget to set the * imports to a high number like 999

when I now migrate using IntelliJ. I can then do a search & replace of Assertions. with ``. This of course leads to compile errors which I can then fix with letting IntelliJ fix the imports (one by one; not sure if there is a fix all). WIth the excluded packages setting at the top it chooses the correct static imports :)
I can use <F2> to jump to the compile errors and then for me on a mac its alt+enter to autofix the missing import. So that is quite quick
replies.author: teleivo

timeline.body: can you please use static imports for the assertions
timeline.bodyText: can you please use static imports for the assertions
timeline.bodyHTML: can you please use static imports for the assertions

replies.bodyText: Please try my settings using the Migrate to Junit 5 on the single class here. That for me gives a nice diff with static imports.

timeline.message: TRUNK-5816: Migrate unit tests to Junit5

timeline.body:
not sure why but the arguments should not be swapped here. the signature is https://junit.org/junit5/docs/5.0.1/api/org/junit/jupiter/api/Assertions.html#assertEquals-double-double- 

expected, then actual. in this case we expect the size to be 1

```suggestion
		assertEquals(1, obsGroup.getGroupMembers().size(), "Duplicate add should not increase the grouped obs size");
```

these things matter in case of error. otherwise we get a confusing message
timeline.bodyHTML:
not sure why but the arguments should not be swapped here. the signature is https://junit.org/junit5/docs/5.0.1/api/org/junit/jupiter/api/Assertions.html#assertEquals-double-double-

expected, then actual. in this case we expect the size to be 1

Suggested change
assertEquals(obsGroup.getGroupMembers().size(), 1, "Duplicate add should not increase the grouped obs size");
assertEquals(1, obsGroup.getGroupMembers().size(), "Duplicate add should not increase the grouped obs size");

these things matter in case of error. otherwise we get a confusing message
timeline.author: teleivo

timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
assertEquals(obsGroup.getGroupMembers().size(), 1, "Removing a non existent obs should not decrease the number of grouped obs");
assertEquals(1, obsGroup.getGroupMembers().size(), "Removing a non existent obs should not decrease the number of grouped obs");
timeline.author: teleivo

timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
assertEquals(members.size(), 3, "set of all members should have length of 3");
assertEquals(3, members.size(), "set of all members should have length of 3");
timeline.author: teleivo

timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
assertEquals(members.size(), 2, "set of non-voided should have length of 2");
assertEquals(2, members.size(), "set of non-voided should have length of 2");
timeline.author: teleivo

timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
assertEquals(members.size(), 2, "default should return non-voided with length of 2");
assertEquals(2, members.size(), "default should return non-voided with length of 2");
timeline.author: teleivo
